Original summary is vague about the linking mechanism. Description is verbose and unclear about inputs/outputs. data.current_description:
You don't need to use this endpoint if you use our JavaScript snippet in your application.

This endpoint is used to link web activity to a user in your application. This will help you discover which channels and campaigns work best.

When our JavaScript snippet is embedded on your website, blog or landing pages, a cookie named "__journey" will be set.
 
This will only work if your website and application are under the same top level domain.

Website, blog or landing pages
* www.my-domain.tld
* blog.my-domain.tld
 * landing-page.my-domain.tld

Application
* app.my-domain.tld

The cookie on my-domain.tld will also be send to your app domain.

You should call this endpoint after the user succesfully logged in (so that you know the user's ID). Use the value of the cookie as device ID.
data.summary_suggestion: Associate web activity cookie with authenticated user
data.description_suggestion: Links web activity tracked via the __journey cookie to an authenticated user account. This enables attribution of web interactions (from marketing sites, blogs, landing pages) to specific users in your application. Call this endpoint immediately after user login with the __journey cookie value as the device identifier. Requires the website and application to share the same top-level domain (e.g., my-domain.tld). Returns 201 on successful linkage. Note: This endpoint is unnecessary if using the journy.io JavaScript snippet, which handles linking automatically.

data.description_suggestion: Creates a new user or updates an existing user's profile information. Accepts user ID, email, name, phone, registration date, and custom properties. Supports partial updates - only provided fields are modified. Recommended to call immediately upon user creation in your system.
